marklogic.body: IMO some of the most frightening aspects of the first film were derived from it's believably gritty spaceship interiors on the Nostromo and the claustrophobic camera work. It looked real, felt like you were there, in a big machine in deep space. No other Science Fiction film I ever experienced gave me quite the sensation of being there. Far from help. Then, when Ridley Scott revealed Giger's ship...and finally Giger's Alien-it was all the more terrifying. First, however, he put you there. With very ordinary people (the crew), in the Cold dark distances where no one can hear you scream.
